___transactionHashes.description: An array of hashes of all transactions that were validated in this ledger.

___closeTimeResolution.description: Approximate number of seconds between closing one ledger version and closing the next one.

___transactions.description: Array of all transactions that were validated in this ledger. Transactions are represented in the same format as the return value of [getTransaction](#gettransaction).

items.description: A transaction in the same format as the return value of [getTransaction](#gettransaction).

___ledgerHash.description: Unique identifying hash of the entire ledger.

___closeFlags.description: A bit-map of flags relating to the closing of this ledger. Currently, the ledger has only one flag defined for `closeFlags`: **sLCF_NoConsensusTime** (value 1). If this flag is enabled, it means that validators were in conflict regarding the correct close time for the ledger, but built otherwise the same ledger, so they declared consensus while "agreeing to disagree" on the close time. In this case, the consensus ledger contains a `closeTime` value that is 1 second after that of the previous ledger. (In this case, there is no official close time, but the actual real-world close time is probably 3-6 seconds later than the specified `closeTime`.)

___parentLedgerHash.description: Unique identifying hash of the ledger that came immediately before this one.

___closeTime.description: The time at which this ledger was closed.

___stateHash.description: Hash of all state information in this ledger.

___rawState.description: A JSON string containing all state data for this ledger in rippled JSON format.

___parentCloseTime.description: The time at which the previous ledger was closed.

___stateHashes.description: An array of hashes of all state data in this ledger.

___transactionHash.description: Hash of the transaction information included in this ledger.

___ledgerVersion.description: The ledger version of this ledger.

___totalDrops.description: Total number of drops (1/1,000,000th of an XRP) in the network, as a quoted integer. (This decreases as transaction fees cause XRP to be destroyed.)
